p: Whole-genome viral sequencing, coupled with phylogenetic analysis and appropriate clinical metadata, can contribute to the accurate tracking of outbreaks across time and space ( 49). The metagenomic method employed here produced >90% complete genomes for 17/27 samples with a C T value of â‰¤30 (Fig. S4), demonstrating the ability of metagenomics to produce sufficient data for influenza virus diagnostics and genome characterization, while also detecting and sequencing other common RNA viruses.
